headline.print_headline: Longtime Lopez Colleague Chosen to Lead Brooklyn Democrats
headline.seo: Frank R. Seddio to Take Over Leadership of Brooklyn Democrats
headline.main: Longtime Lopez Colleague Chosen to Lead Brooklyn Democrats

docs.snippet: Frank R. Seddio, a gregarious lawyer, has sought to distance himself from the scandal-tarnished Brooklyn Democratic chairman Vito J. Lopez....
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Democratic Party chooses Frank R Seddio to succeed scandal-tarnished Vito J Lopez as chairman.
docs.lead_paragraph: Frank R. Seddio, a gregarious lawyer, has sought to distance himself from the scandal-tarnished Brooklyn Democratic chairman Vito J. Lopez.

headline.print_headline: Mets Find Way to Lose In Harvey’s Final Start
headline.seo: Harvey Shines but Mets Don’t in Loss to Phillies
headline.main: Harvey Shines but Mets Don’t in Loss to Phillies

docs.snippet: Ryan Howard’s ninth-inning home run for the Phillies spoiled a dazzling performance by Matt Harvey, the promising Mets rookie right-hander, who allowed only one hit over seven innings....
docs.abstract: Philadelphia Phillies defeat the New York Mets, 3-2.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ryan Howard’s ninth-inning home run for the Phillies spoiled a dazzling performance by Matt Harvey, the promising Mets rookie right-hander, who allowed only one hit over seven innings.

headline.main: T.C.U.’s Top Rusher Out With Knee Injury

docs.snippet: Texas Christian’s leading rusher, Waymon James, will miss the rest of the season for the 17th-ranked Horned Frogs because of a knee injury....
docs.lead_paragraph: Texas Christian’s leading rusher, Waymon James, will miss the rest of the season for the 17th-ranked Horned Frogs because of a knee injury.

headline.print_headline: In a City Plagued by Violence, a Spike in Crime Opens Eyes Nationwide
headline.seo: Marseille Hit by Violent Wave of Drug Crimes
headline.main: In a City Plagued by Violence, a Spike in Crime Opens Eyes Nationwide

docs.snippet: In Marseille, where 20 people have been killed in the last nine months, drug dealers have begun using combat weapons to defend their territory....
docs.abstract: Marseille Journal; 20 people have been killed in gang crime in the last nine months in Marseille, one of France's poorest cities; magnitude of violence, which police say is committed mostly by drug dealers using combat weapons to defend their territory, has pushed the government to lay out an ambitious plan to help the city, including increasing the number of police officers.
docs.lead_paragraph: In Marseille, where 20 people have been killed in the last nine months, drug dealers have begun using combat weapons to defend their territory.

headline.print_headline: On Air and Before Audiences, Romney Makes Push for Hispanic Vote
headline.seo: In Ads and Before Audiences, Romney Bids for Latino Vote
headline.main: On Air and Before Audiences, Romney Makes Push for Hispanic Vote

docs.snippet: Mitt Romney is intensifying his push for Hispanic voters, ratcheting up his Spanish-language advertising and putting himself in front of a growing number of Hispanic audiences....
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney is intensifying his push for Hispanic voters, ratcheting up his Spanish-language advertising and putting himself in front of a growing number of Hispanic audiences; effort has so far been an uphill climb, with Pres Obama maintaining a commanding lead among Latino voters.

byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is intensifying his push for Hispanic voters, ratcheting up his Spanish-language advertising and putting himself in front of a growing number of Hispanic audiences.

docs.snippet: Soccer players with ties to Kosovo are seeking recognition for a national soccer team....
docs.lead_paragraph: Soccer players with ties to Kosovo are seeking recognition for a national soccer team.

docs.snippet: Belarus denied visas for two observers from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, representing a rocky resumption of ties with the election-monitoring group....

keywords.value: Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Belarus, preparing to hold a parliamentary election, denies visas for two observers from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe; OCSE is returning to Belarus for the first time since it was expelled after a contentious 2010 presidential election.
docs.lead_paragraph: Belarus denied visas for two observers from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, representing a rocky resumption of ties with the election-monitoring group.

headline.print_headline: Inspectors Certified Pakistani Factory as Safe Before Disaster
headline.seo: Pakistan Factory Passed Inspection Before Fire
headline.main: Inspectors Certified Pakistani Factory as Safe Before Disaster

docs.snippet: The fire in Karachi that killed hundreds has cast doubt on the system many Western companies rely on to certify low-cost suppliers....
docs.abstract: Prominent factory monitoring group heavily financed by industry gave clean bill of health to a Pakistani apparel plant in Karachi, just weeks before fire on Sept 12 engulfed premises and killed nearly 300 workers; tragedy casts doubt on factory monitoring system that many Western companies rely on to certify low-cost suppliers.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and STEVEN GREENHOUSE
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from Islamabad, and Steven Greenhouse from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fire in Karachi that killed hundreds has cast doubt on the system many Western companies rely on to certify low-cost suppliers.

headline.print_headline: Defrocked Priest Sues New York Archdiocese for Libel Over Sexual Abuse
headline.seo: Defrocked Monsignor, Charles Kavanagh, Sues New York Archdiocese for Libel
headline.main: Defrocked Priest Sues New York Archdiocese for Libel Over Sexual Abuse Statement

docs.snippet: Charles M. Kavanagh, 75, says a news release by the archdiocese this May implied a pattern of sexual abuse accusations that he says never happened....
docs.abstract: Charles M Kavanagh, once-prominent Roman Catholic monsignor who was removed from the priesthood in 2010 for sexual abuse of a minor, files a federal lawsuit against the New York Archdiocese, claiming he had been libeled in a church statement.
docs.lead_paragraph: Charles M. Kavanagh, 75, says a news release by the archdiocese this May implied a pattern of sexual abuse accusations that he says never happened.

headline.print_headline: South Dakota: Ceremonial Tobacco Is Approved For Indian Inmates
headline.main: South Dakota: Ceremonial Tobacco Is Approved for Indian Inmates

docs.snippet: A federal judge has ruled in a lawsuit by two prisoners that the state’s prison system’s ban on tobacco in religious ceremonies substantially burdens American Indian inmates’ religious rights....
docs.abstract: Federal Judge Karen Schreier rules that the South Dakota prison system's ban on tobacco in religious ceremonies substantially burdens American Indian inmates' religious rights.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has ruled in a lawsuit by two prisoners that the state’s prison system’s ban on tobacco in religious ceremonies substantially burdens American Indian inmates’ religious rights.
